pageContext.claim: “This will be the biggest farm deal ever made, if you think about it. I don't think anything will be close, because it's China.”
pageContext.analysis: This is doubtful. The reworking of the North American Free Trade Agreement with Canada and Mexico is probably a bigger farm deal than any accord with China. The U.S. in 2017 had $20.5 billion in agricultural trade with Canada and $18.6 billion with Mexico, for a total of nearly $40 billion, compared with $19.6 billion with China.
